 California Digital Library 
 
 About CDL 
 
 
 Policies and Guidelines 
 
 
Accessibility for People with Disabilities
   
 
 
 
 Accessibility for People with Disabilities   
 
 The California Digital Library is committed to making our websites accessible to everyone, including individuals with disabilities. 
 Our website is built to be accessible via screen readers, keyboard navigation, and mobile devices. Older, legacy pages may not meet these standards yet, but we are working to update them on an ongoing basis. 
 For more information about CDL and the University of California Office of the President IT accessibility policy and programs, please visit the  University of California Electronic Accessibility website . 
 Report an Accessibility Problem 
 If you have trouble using a CDL website or accessing our content due to a disability of any kind, please let us know.  Fill out the form below, and we will do our best to provide the information you are seeking as soon as we can. 
 
   
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Your Name (required) 
   
  Your Email (required) 
   
  Website where you encountered the problem (required) 
 select one cdlib.org AGUA Calisphere Dryad DMPTool eScholarship EZID Merritt OAC UC Libraries other   
  If you selected “other,” please enter the website here 
   
  Address / URL of the specific web page or content you tried to access (required) 
   
  Please describe the accessibility problem you experienced (required)
